container.heading: Submission of Hospital Discharge Data Set to the Commission

para.text: Beginning on January 1, 2014, each hospital under the jurisdiction of the Health Services Cost Review Commission shall submit to the Commission:
The data elements required by this chapter within 15 days after the last day of the month when the patient was discharged or died; and
The reconciliation of inpatient data between the discharge data and the financial data filed with the Commission.
The data elements submitted under §A(1) o this regulation shall be made in the form as published in the Maryland Register and on the Commission’s website (http://hscrc.maryland.gov).
The reconciliation submitted under §A(2) of this regulation shall be made in the manner, form, and time frame prescribed by Commission staff.
A hospital may apply to the Commission for an exception or an extension to its filing requirements as provided in COMAR 10.37.01.02 and .03.
Failure to submit the required data and reconciliation information in a timely manner may subject the hospital to monetary penalties as provided in Commission law and regulation.

The requirements for the collection and submission of data as described in Regulation .01 of this chapter shall also apply to those non-federal acute care hospitals located in Delaware, Pennsylvania, Virginia, West Virginia, and the District of Columbia. Data submitted by these non-Maryland hospitals shall relate exclusively to those patients who are Maryland residents.

The Commission may consider these non-Maryland hospitals that otherwise provide discharge data as described in Regulation .04 of this chapter to the public to be exempt from the data requirements referred to in §A of this regulation. In addition, non-Maryland hospitals may apply to the Commission for an exception or an extension to either the form or to the manner of these data requirements as provided for in COMAR 10.37.01.02 and .03.

If a non-Maryland hospital fails to submit discharge data on all Maryland patients as required by the Commission, the matter shall be referred by the Commission to Maryland's Medical Assistance Program for appropriate action.

section.heading: Uniform Hospital Discharge Abstract Data Set.
section.text: Data Elements are as published in the Maryland Register and on the Commission's website (http://www.hscrc.state. md.us).

section.heading: Privacy of Information.
section.text: Data submitted in accordance with this chapter are not public information pursuant to Health-General Article, §19-207(d), Annotated Code of Maryland.

section.heading: Summary Studies, Reports, Compilations.
section.text: Summary studies, reports, or other compilations developed by the Commission or its staff from the data submitted in accordance with this chapter shall be public information except that disclosure may not be made in a way that the data furnished by a specific patient can be identified.

section.heading: Corrections to Data.
section.text: The Commission shall prescribe the process for hospitals to submit corrections and revisions to the data on its website.

annotations.annotation: Health-General Article, §§19-207, 19-211, 19-212, 19-215, and 19-216, Annotated Code of Maryland
